title: Senior Manager, Strategy & M&A
description:
**A Unique Career Opportunity at ASSA ABLOY / HID!**
**Location: Stockholm, Sweden**
**Job ID: 36209**
 Are you passionate about solving complex strategic business challenges whilst managing a team in an international environment? If so, we would like to hear from you!
   

  

 HID is looking for a
 **Senior Strategy & M&A Manager** 
 to join the
 **Identification Technologies (IDT)** 
 Business Area (BA). As the Senior Strategy & M&A Manager, you will lead the Strategy & M&A team at IDT and drive the formulation and execution of IDT's business strategy. You will have direct access to the BA’s executive decision-makers and collaborate closely with the IDT management team to own and run high-priority strategy and M&A projects, from ideation to execution.
   

  

 In this highly visible role, you will report directly to the Vice President of Revenue Operations, Strategy & M&A at IDT and have one direct report (separate recruitment process ongoing for a Strategy & M&A Manager). The location for the position is in
 **Stockholm** 
 , Sweden and includes occasional traveling.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 HID belongs to the global access solution group ASSA ABLOY, which is headquartered in Stockholm. Every day, millions of people in more than 100 countries use HID’s products and services to securely access physical and digital places. Over 2 billion things that need to be identified, verified and tracked are connected through HID’s technology. Headquartered in Austin, US, HID has over 4,000 employees worldwide.
   

  

 Within HID, you will find Identification Technologies or IDT, which is a fast-growing Business Area providing a broad portfolio of contactless identification technologies (RFID / NFC, BLE, UWB etc.) across various industries, such as Manufacturing, Logistics & Supply chain, Healthcare and Access Control. More specifically, IDT offers smart credentials (RFID tags & cards), RFID readers, services & software to securely identify, track and manage assets and identities. IDT has experienced significant growth in the last 5 years – both organically and through M&A with 13 acquisitions done since 2019 – and is considered one of HID’s “growth engines”.
   

  

**As IDT’s Senior Strategy & M&A Manager, you will support our continued success by:**
* Leading and developing IDT’s Strategy & M&A team (one direct report to be hired).
* Owning and driving strategic projects and initiatives from ideation to execution.
* Owning IDT’s overall strategy as well as providing strategic support to IDT’s 10 business units (BUs) around the world.
* Owning and running M&A projects ranging from target scanning to commercial due diligence and integration of acquired companies.
* Delivering extensive market and competitive analyses to drive business insights and support decision-making.
* Owning the development of strategy & M&A presentations to ASSA ABLOY Group and HID Management.


**What we will love about your background:**
* Strong project management and leadership/coaching skills.
* Ability to effectively present and communicate both in speech and writing.
* Strong strategic, analytical and problem-solving skills in combination with a practical and action-oriented mindset.
* Collaborative personality and mindset being a true team player.
* Ability to effectively manage various stakeholders, building trust, and influencing across geographies, functions and executive levels.


**Your Experience and Education include:**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Economics or Engineering. Master’s Degree valued.
* 4-6 years of relevant professional experience from top-tier management consulting, strategy/business development line role, investment banking or similar.
* High proficiency with Microsoft products especially Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).
* Ability to travel internationally when needed.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


**What we can offer you:**
* Competitive salary and rewards package.
* Competitive benefits and annual leave offering, allowing for work-life balance.
* A vibrant, welcoming & inclusive culture.
* Extensive career development opportunities and resources to maximize your potential.
* To be a part of a global organization that is pioneering the hardware, software and services that allow people to confidently navigate the physical and digital worlds.


**Why apply?**
* Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to apply.
* Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers.
* Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted.


**We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!**
 On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.
   

  

 When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Lösningsarkitekt till hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen
description:
Är du en driven och lyhörd person? Vill du få möjlighet att bidra och ta ansvar i en samhällsviktig kontext? Nu söker Hälso och sjukvårdsförvaltningen en senior Lösningsarkitekt till sitt team. Här blir du en viktig kugge i vår arkitektfunktion och kan påverka med din erfarenhet och kompetens till vår verksamhet.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I den här rollen blir du en nyckelspelare i både pågående initiativ och i att stärka vår arkitektoniska förmåga. I nära samarbete med dina kollegor vidareutvecklar du processer, metoder och verktyg för en hållbar, skalbar och säker IT-miljö. Du får möjlighet att påverka strategiska vägval, samarbeta med verksamhetsansvariga och andra arkitekter samt driva förädlingen av vår arkitektur. Genom kontinuerlig utveckling och effektiva samarbeten bidrar du till en framåtdriven digital transformation och gör konkret skillnad för patienter och vårdpersonal i hela regionen.
   

  

**Några av delarna i rollen:**
* ta en aktiv del i projekt
* bidra till att översätta process- och informationsmodeller mot behov och krav i system och flöden
* vara drivande inom din expertis


 Vidare bidrar du till att säkerställa att vi tillsammans tar hänsyn till processer, funktionella- och icke-funktionella krav såsom prestanda, skalbarhet, robusthet och förvaltningsbarhet på ett relevant sätt.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som person är du lyhörd och driven med en förmåga att lyfta blicken. Vidare är du kommunikativ och skicklig på att visualisera, presentera och föra en dialog kring komplexa lösningar på ett konkret och lättillgängligt sätt. Du är dessutom utåtriktad med en god samarbetsförmåga. För att passa för rollen ser vi att du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område såsom exempelvis data/systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad genom gedigen arbetslivserfarenhet.
   

  

**Du har med dig erfarenhet av:**
* IT- och lösningsarkitektur
* att leda och ge stöd i arkitektur- och designarbete, tekniska vägval samt guida initiativ


 och ta fram arkitekturdesign
   

  

* arkitekturstyrning
* modellering i arkitekturverktyg som exempelvis LeanIX
* att dokumentera och sammanställa arkitektur- och systemdokumentation
* både förvaltning och nyutveckling av projekt


 Vidare har du utmärkta kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift och vana vid agilt projektarbete samt att arbeta självständigt och målinriktat.
   

  

**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:**
* arbete inom offentlig sektor
* hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn
* REST API, FHIR, IAM, Databas och katalogtjänster
* bakgrund inom utveckling
* storskaliga integrationslösningar
* stora komplexa system- och applikationslandskap


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid.
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Du erbjuds även kompetensutveckling i olika former som exempelvis nätverk, mentor- och adeptsprogram samt ledarutbildning.
   

  

 Vi sitter i ljusa fina lokaler på Lindhagensgatan 98. Hit tar du dig enkelt med kollektivtrafiken.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. Sista ansökningsdag är den 23 april. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Region Stockholm med IDG Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Linda Wallin, Rekryteringskonsult på 072 2276720, linda.wallin@foundryco.com.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tester kan komma att ingå i rekryteringsprocessen. Vi använder oss av Assessios tester MAP och Matrigma. MAP är en personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett problemlösningstest som båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser.
   

  

 Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen stödjer Region Stockholms politiska organisation för att invånarna i Stockholms län har tillgång till en god och säker hälso- och sjukvård samt tandvård. Det innebär att förvaltningen beställer och följer upp hälso- och sjukvård och tandvård för 75 miljarder kronor årligen.
   

  

 Förvaltningen ansvarar också för kunskapsstyrningsorganisationen i Region Stockholm, samt en rad funktioner som är avgörande för hälso- och sjukvårdssystemet, såsom smittskydd, vårdhygien, kris- och katastrofberedskap.
   

  

 Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen stödjer Region Stockholms politiska organisation för att invånarna i Stockholms län har tillgång till en god och säker hälso- och sjukvård samt tandvård. Det innebär att förvaltningen beställer och följer upp hälso- och sjukvård och tandvård för 75 miljarder kronor årligen. Förvaltningen ansvarar också för kunskapsstyrningsorganisationen i Region Stockholm, samt en rad funktioner som är avgörande för hälso- och sjukvårdssystemet, såsom smittskydd, vårdhygien. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: Lead Cloud Architect, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you ready to revolutionize SaaS operations? We're not just keeping up with the industry—we're redefining it. As our Lead Cloud Architect, you'll spearhead the creation of an AI-powered SaaS Ops powerhouse that will set new standards for efficiency, reliability, and scalability across a diverse portfolio of acquired businesses.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Architect and implement cutting-edge SaaS Ops strategies, leveraging your expertise to drive operational excellence
* Make high-impact decisions on operational standards, AI tooling, and process design to ensure unparalleled reliability, security, and cost optimization across our growing portfolio
* Develop and refine a seamless framework for integrating newly acquired SaaS products into our centralized operations, eliminating friction and maximizing efficiency
* Pioneer the use of AI-powered tools to automate processes, optimize costs, and elevate operational performance to unprecedented levels


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Drowning in the manual drudgery of traditional SaaS Ops—your mission is to innovate and automate
* Managing operations for a single product—you'll be orchestrating excellence across a diverse, ever-expanding portfolio of SaaS businesses
* Maintaining the status quo—you're here to disrupt, redefine, and set new benchmarks in AI-driven operations


**Lead Cloud Architect Key Responsibilities**
 Drive the creation and continuous evolution of a highly efficient, AI-powered SaaS Ops function that ensures exceptional reliability, cost optimization, and seamless operations across our rapidly growing portfolio of acquired SaaS businesses, setting new industry standards for operational excellence.
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* Proven track record of 5+ years managing and owning SaaS Ops for enterprise-level customers
* Demonstrated success in leading major cloud migrations and owning SaaS Ops at an SME serving enterprise clients
* Expertise in applying AI and automation technologies to revolutionize SaaS operations
* Advanced proficiency in AWS and DevOps practices, including mastery of Docker and Kubernetes


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5563-SE-Stockhol-LeadCloudArchi.001

title: Sektionschef-sektionen för systemförvaltningsledning
description:
**Regeringskansliets enhet för Utveckling**
 Förvaltningsavdelningens verksamhet är sedan 1 september 2024 indelad i sex avdelningar. Flera av avdelningarna har genomgått en omorganisation som trätt i kraft vid årsskiftet. Nu rekryteras till nya befattningar som enhetschefer och sektionschefer vid dessa avdelningar. Digitaliseringsavdelningen består sedan årsskiftet av fyra enheter. En enhet för drift och underhåll, en enhet för utveckling, en enhet för teknisk styrning och innovation samt enheten kontaktcenter.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Vi söker nu sektionschef till sektionen för systemförvaltningsledning. Som chef leder du sektionens arbete och ansvarar för dess planering samt uppföljning av resultat och ekonomiskt utfall. I rollen ingår budget, verksamhets- och personalansvar och du främjar god arbetsmiljö, jämställdhet och kompetensutveckling för sektionens personal. Du ingår i enhetsledningen och är en del av enhetens chefsgrupp där du aktivt bidrar till förändrings- och utvecklingsarbete.
   

  

 Sektionen Systemförvaltningsledning har 8 medarbetare och ansvarar för att översätta verksamhetsbehov till IT-aktiviteter för planering och samordning. Sektionen säkerställer vidare att IT-stödet motsvarar verksamhetens behov, samt möter relevanta krav exempelvis inom IT-säkerhetsområdet. Sektionens leveranser ska bidra till att myndigheten får systemlösningar som ger önskad verksamhetsnytta och som förenklar och effektiviserar vardagen för medarbetarna i organisationen. Under året kommer en ny förvaltningsmodell att implementeras vilket kommer vara både viktigt och tongivande för hela sektionens arbete och struktur.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med löpande utveckling av både arbetssätt, kompetens, leverans- och organisationsindelning varför gruppens ansvarsområden kan komma att justeras över tid. I din roll bidrar du till effektivisering genom att verka för en miljö som stimulerar till samarbete samt utveckla sektionens del i enhetens gemensamma arbetssätt och leveranser i takt med förändrade verksamhetsbehov och it-branschens utbud. Som sektionschef företräder du också verksamheten i många olika sammanhang, såväl internt som externt.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Vi söker dig som högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom för tjänsten relevant område eller annan lämplig utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer vara relevant för befattningen. Har du även genomgott relevanta ledarskapsutbildningar är det meriterande. Du har även erfarenhet av en chefsroll inom relevant IT-område med leverans-, personal- och budgetansvar. Du har även erfarenhet av portfölj-styrning med avseende på resurstilldelning, prioritering och uppföljning. Vidare har du kunskap och förståelse i förvaltningsmodeller, gärna PM3 samt kunskap om ITIL.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av relevant arbete inom Regeringskansliets IT- och digitaliseringsavdelning. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av kund/ användardrivet utvecklingsarbete inom IT/digitalisering, samt med kunskap om projektledning
   

  

 Du behöver kunna uttrycka dig mycket väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 I rollen som sektionschef behöver du ha god ledarförmåga och du skapar engagemang och delaktighet. Som ledare visar du tillit genom att coacha och delegera, för att generera lösningar och frigöra medarbetares potential. Du har en förmåga att skapa förtroendefullt samarbete på alla nivåer både internt och externt. Du har även en god kommunikativ- och pedagogisk förmåga samt att du värdesätter goda relationer. Som ledare har du även förmåga att omsätta uppsatta övergripande mål till praktisk handling och resultat samt att du har en problemlösande och analytisk förmåga. Du har även en vilja att utvecklas och lära nytt och är initiativrik som person. Vi fäster stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Du anställs tillsvidare med ett tidsbegränsat förordnande som chef. Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta tf enhetschef Sofia Tingåker på 08- 405 82 94. Du är också välkommen att kontakta rekryteringsspecialist Siri Hågefalk på 08-405 87 83. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Johan Strokirk för Saco och Jan Wahlströmför för ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg
 **senast den 16:e april.**
 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: Business Controller
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Are you passionate about making a sustainable impact in the world of electric transport? Do you thrive in an innovative and entrepreneurial environment? Then you might be the new Business Controller to Erinion! At Erinion, part of the Scania Group, we are leading the global shift towards a more sustainable transport system by shaping the future within charging and e-mobility.
 



  
 



 Your role As a Business Controller at Erinion, you will play a key role in driving financial performance and providing strategic insights that shape our business decisions. You will work closely with the CFO, senior leadership, and cross-functional teams to analyze financial data, support commercial strategy, and improve operational efficiency.
 



 In this role, you will be play a key role in financial planning, business performance tracking, and profitability optimization – ensuring that your insights directly support Erinion’s growth journey and international expansion.
 



  
 



**Your responsibilities** 




 · Lead financial analysis, business performance tracking, and cost control initiatives.
 



 · Develop and maintain financial models, forecasts, and reporting structures to support decision-making.
 



 · Work closely with commercial and operational teams to evaluate customer proposals and support business case development.
 



 · Prepare financial material and presentations to support strategic initiatives and board-level discussions.
 



 · Drive budgeting and forecasting processes in alignment with the company’s objectives and growth ambitions.
 



 · Conduct variance analysis and deep-dive reviews – including invoice-level investigations – to ensure financial accuracy and identify improvement opportunities.
 



 · Contribute to the structuring and assessment of financing options in connection with strategic customer or partner agreements.
 



 · Support process improvements, automation, and enhanced data transparency using data analytics tools like PowerBI and Excel.
 



  
 



**Your Profile** 




 We are looking for an analytical and business-driven finance professional who thrives in a dynamic and growth-focused environment. You have strong financial acumen, a strategic mindset, and the ability to translate data into actionable insights. You are proactive, collaborative, and eager to make an impact in a fast-evolving industry.
 



  
 



 · Bachelor's or master's degree in finance, business administration, accounting, engineering, or a related field.
 



 · 4+ years of experience in business controlling, financial analysis, management consulting, or a similar role.
 



 · Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex financial data and provide strategic recommendations.
 



 · Experience in budgeting, forecasting, and performance management.
 



 · Proficiency in financial modelling in Excel and other business intelligence tools
 



 · Strong proficiency in financial systems and digital tools, with a focus on process mapping and automation. Experience in leveraging AI-driven technologies to optimize financial workflows and decision-making is a plus.
 



 · Fluency in Swedish and English
 



 · Experience in a fast-growing, international, or scale-up environment is a plus.
 



  
 



  
 



**Our business** 




 We offer private and semi-public charging solutions to build, own and operate infrastructure at customer sites to enhance their operational efficiency, minimize cost and increase flexibility. Erinion is on a fast-paced growth trajectory, if you thrive in dynamic environments fuelled by innovation and collaboration, then Erinion is the place for you!
 



  
 



**Our offer** 




 Join our passionate team in Stockholm city, at Drottninggatan 29, and be a driving force in the future of sustainable transportation. At Erinion, you won't just be a part of the change, you'll be pioneering it. We offer a competitive compensation package, alongside unparalleled professional growth opportunities. This is an early-stage company where your ideas are valued, your contributions have a significant impact, and you have the chance to develop and grow alongside Erinion.
 



  
 



**Further information and application** 




 We are driven by our belief that the power of diversity fuels innovation. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. We are working with an ongoing selection; please apply as soon as possible if you are interested, but no later than 2025-04-09. Your application should include your CV and certificate of your highest finished degree. Please note that we cannot accept applications over email. If you have any further questions contact Linda Rosenqvist at linda.rosenqvist@scania.com. A background check might be conducted for this position
 



 We look forward to your application!
 



  





 Apply here: https://jobs.scania.com/job/S%C3%B6dert%C3%A4lje-Business-Controller-to-Erinion-151-38/1187300301/

title: Commercial Manager & Regional Lead Scandinavia
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Join us as a Commercial Manager & Regional Lead Scandinavia. You will lead our Commercial Partnerships team in Scandinavia, overseeing supplier relations and managing a team of 3-5 direct reports working with the Swedish & Norwegian markets. You will be reporting to Global Head of Commercial Partnerships. This pivotal role involves driving our business’s strategic agenda through robust supplier relationships, team leadership, and operational excellence. You will be instrumental in negotiating product assortment, pricing strategies, promotional activities and marketing investments to enhance Haypp Group’s market position. As a key player, you'll collaborate closely with our Business Unit Managers in respective markets to achieve joint KPIs such as Volume, Revenue, and Gross Margin.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead, develop, and motivate a team of 3-5 direct reports, ensuring high performance and engagement.
* Optimize workflows and processes to enhance efficiency and value creation.
* Reduce dependency on individuals by building structured processes and ways of working.
* Set clear guidelines for supplier collaboration and continuously improve internal and external workflows.
* Balance flexibility with structure to maximize value while managing complexity.
* Develop and execute supplier strategies for each market.
* Ensure structured reporting on market challenges and opportunities.
* Conduct performance reviews, development plans, and goal setting for team members.


**What We Want From You**
 We are looking for a seasoned leader who has:
   

  

* Proven experience in a similar role involving supplier or partnership management within the FMCG industry.
* Experience from the tobacco / nicotine industry is meriting but not a requirement
* Strong leadership skills with min. 5 years of experience managing and developing a high performing team.
* A high ability to set and drive a strategic agenda.
* Negotiation skills and experience in commercial agreements.
* Fluency in English; additional languages are a plus.
* A degree in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.


 If you are an analytical, commercially astute leader who thrives on building strong teams, optimizing processes, and driving results, this is an opportunity to make a real impact in our industry.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.

title: Security and SHEQ Manager, Sweden/DACH
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
**Olivier Dussutour** 
 , our CEO, is seeking for a Security and SHEQ (Safety, Health, Environment, and Quality) Manager to uphold top standards of security, safety and quality frameworks.
   

  

 If you thrive in tech and international environments this might be the right opportunity for you. You will have the opportunity to shape and impact a security-aware organization across Europe, helping us reinforce our core business of trust.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Engage with various departments to cultivate a culture of safety and continuous improvement.
* Lead initiatives that prioritize sustainability and environmental responsibility.
* At Nexus, part of IN Groupe, we are leaders in high-tech trust and safety solutions. As a Security and SHEQ Manager, you'll be a pivotal player in a company where trust is central. Your work will have a significant impact on our commitment to innovation and the standards we set in the industry.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 As a Security and SHEQ Manager, you will be the key figure overseeing comprehensive security programs across the Nordics and Germany, with a primary focus on general security and safety. A special focus will be on physical security and business continuity. You will also act as the Chief of security in tenders and in client interactions. You will develop and implement strategies to protect assets, facilities, and personnel, while also managing SHEQ systems to promote a culture of safety, compliance, and operational excellence throughout the organization.
   

  

 Responsibilities includes
   

  

* Develop and implement comprehensive physical security policies, protocols and procedures to safeguard facilities, personnel, and assets.
* Work closely with our corporate information security team to ensure seamless integration of cybersecurity and physical security measures for a unified security approach.
* Lead and conduct risk assessments for both physical security and SHEQ aspects; develop and execute effective mitigation strategies.
* Manage security personnel and coordinate with facilities management to maintain secure environments across locations.
* Develop, implement, and maintain robust SHEQ management systems in compliance with regulatory standards and organizational goals and liaison with group counterparts to cascade group policy.
* Lead incident investigations related to security breaches and SHEQ incidents; implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for SHEQ initiatives; report on performance to senior management.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance safety, environmental sustainability, and overall quality standards organization-wide.


**About You**
* You take pride in your meticulous approach, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in every task.
* You confidently express your ideas and decisions, driving projects forward effectively.
* You enjoy anticipating needs and opportunities, taking initiative to address issues and drive improvements.
* You excel at analyzing complex situations, deriving meaningful insights from data.
* You maintain positivity and adaptability in overcoming challenges and setbacks.


**Qualifications**
* You possess a relevant academic degree.
* You are experienced in the Security field.
* You are fluent in Swedish and proficient English.
* You are experienced with ISO 9001.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* You are experienced in Tech and infrastructure.
* You are familiar with ISO 27001, ISO 14001 and TISAX.
* You are experienced in SOA classification.


**About Your Application**
 Please note that due to summer vacations, the feedback on applications may be slower during the month of July. However, we encourage you to apply as we will review all applications and respond as soon as possible.
   

  

**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**Please upload your CV in English**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.
   

  

**Joining Nexus** 
 means becoming a part of IN Groupe, an international group of around 2000 employees on five continents.
   

  

 IN Groupe and Nexus are here to protect the identities of people and things making life both safer and simpler.
   

  

 The group meets the needs of states, businesses, and hundreds of millions of users in Europe and throughout the world.
   

  

 We provide the best of technology and innovation, in a sustainable manner, now and for future generations.
   

  

 At Nexus we believe transparency is a prerequisite for trust and therefore all our
 **products and services are documented online.**

title: Sektionschef till Försvarsstabens Värnpliktssäkerhetssektion
description:
**Befattningen erbjuder** 
 Vill du göra Sverige och Försvarsmakten säkrare? På Försvarsstabens Värnpliktssäkerhetssektion kan du göra det varje dag tillsammans med kompetenta och drivande kollegor inom personalsäkerhetsområdet.
   

  

**Om Försvarsstaben** 
 Försvarsstaben stödjer överbefälhavaren med att handlägga och bereda ärenden på militärstrategisk nivå, samt säkerställer att beslut som fattas av myndighetens ledning genomförs, följs upp och återredovisas. Försvarsstaben ansvarar även för att omsätta regeringens styrning av Försvarsmakten till strategiska planer och för att inrikta försvarsgrens- och stridskraftschefer. Vidare har Försvarsstaben ett övergripande ansvar för att samordna personal-, infrastruktur- och materielförsörjning.
   

  

**Om Försvarsstabens säkerhetsavdelning**
 Säkerhetsavdelningen är placerad under chefen Försvarsstaben och ansvarar för säkerhetstjänsten inom chefen Försvarsstabens verksamhetsansvar. Avdelningen består av Säkerhetssektionen, Suasektionen och Värnpliktssäkerhetssektionen. Denna befattning är placerad vid Värnpliktssäkerhetssektionen med ansvar för personalsäkerheten avseende värnpliktiga. Avdelningen och sektionen samverkar med alla försvarsgrenar och stridskrafter såväl som med närliggande myndigheter och då främst med Plikt- och prövningsverket.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Säkerhetsavdelningens Värnpliktssäkerhetssektion söker en erfaren chef med hög kompetens och erfarenhet inom säkerhetsskyddsområdet. Som chef ska du leda och utveckla medarbetarna i deras arbete med att säkerställa en robust och effektiv handläggning för att följa säkerhetskyddslagstiftningen krav inom personalsäkerhetsområdet avseende värnpliktiga.
   

  

 Som chef Värnpliktssäkerhetssektionen ansvarar du för att inrikta och sammanhålla arbetet med säkerhetsprövning av värnpliktiga. I ansvaret ligger att samordna de enheter som genomför säkerhetsprövningarna på mönstringskontoren i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Umeå.
   

  

 Chefen för Värnpliktssäkerhetssektionen har även ett stort ansvar för att utveckla organisation, personal och metod inom området. Du fattar beslut i säkerhetsprövningsärenden och tillser att arkivet med personakterna hålls aktuellt.
   

  

**KRAV
   

  

 Kvalifikationer**
* Relevant och väl vitsordad chefs- och ledarerfarenhet med personalansvar.
* Erfarenhet av att ha lett verksamhet inom personalsäkerhet, och då främst säkerhetsprövning, gärna inom statlig myndighet
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning alternativt annan erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska.
* B-körkort


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Du har en god förståelse för ledarskap och styrning inom myndighet och vana av att leda verksamhet som omges av sekretess. För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du kan leda, motivera och skapa engagemang och delaktighet för att nå uppställda mål. Som person har du stor personlig mognad och är en förebild för andra i vardagen. Du har ett gott omdöme som påverkar dina prioriteringar, beslut och ditt agerande. Du har en god förmåga till samarbete över organisatoriska gränser. Du är inte rädd för att påverka, leda och ändra arbetsplats- och säkerhetskultur i nya riktningar. Som person är du positiv, kreativ och har en ödmjuk inställning till kollegor och arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**MERITERANDE**
* Utbildad säkerhetschef och/eller it-säkerhetschef.
* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att genomföra utbildningar inom personalsäkerhetsområdet.
* Erfarenhet och utbildning inom säkerhetsskyddsområdet. Exempelvis säkerhetsskyddsplanering, säkerhetsskyddsanalys och befattningsanalys.
* Aktuell kunskap och förståelse kring säkerhetsskyddslagstiftning och Försvarsmaktens regelverk främst inom personalsäkerhet.
* Kunskap om regelverk gällande värnplikt.
* Kunskap i hantering av Försvarsmaktens krigsorganisation och beredskapssystem.


*För att myndighetens uppdrag ska vara framgångsrikt förutsätts att alla medarbetare uppträder enligt den värdegrund som finns. Försvarsmaktens värdegrund slår vakt om alla människors lika värde, rättvisa och jämlikhet och främjar demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter (läs mer på www.forsvarsmakten.se).*
**Övrigt:
   

  

 Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning för dig som inte tidigare är anställd inom Försvarsmakten.
   

  

**Sysselsättningsgrad:** 
 Heltid.
   

  

**Arbetsort:** 
 Stockholm. Resor ingår i tjänsten.
   

  

**Tillträdesdatum:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**För upplysningar om befattningen kontakta:** 
 Avdelningschef Jim Stalpe på 070-386 88 93.
   

  

**För information om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:** 
 HR-specialist Paulina Unger på 070-818 53 14.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare:** 
 OFR/O HKV, Arne Nilsson
   

  

 OFR/S HKV, Kjell Tetzlaff
   

  

 SACO HKV, Stefan Ungerth
   

  

 SEKO Försvar HKV, Lise-Lotte Larsson
   

  

 Samtliga nås via växeln på 08-788 75 00
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:**
***Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-04-28. Din ansökan bör innehålla CV samt ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning.***
**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 ----------------------------------------------------- Information om det rekryterande förbandet: I Högkvarteret finns överbefälhavaren och generaldirektören. Högkvarteret har ungefär 1 000 medarbetare – både yrkesofficerare och civila experter. Högkvarteret utgörs från 2023-01-01 av försvarsstaben, operationsledningen, militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten, samt Högkvarterets stabsavdelning och fristående enheter för tillsyn. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 Danfoss is looking for a convincing and enthusiastic
 **Technical Support Engineer** 
 to provide technical support to our refrigeration wholesalers and indirect commercial refrigeration customers in Sweden. Are you able to work self-driven and to take ownership of technical issues and solve problems through your expertise? Then you might be our new Technical Support Engineer within Danfoss Cooling Segment. You are also looking for a challenge. Danfoss has the biggest portfolio of components for refrigeration in the industry. In combination with all the possible applications and all the new products Danfoss is bringing to the market, you will never get bored. As part of the Technical Support team for Nordics you will closely collaborate with our sales account managers and technical colleagues in the EU.
   

  

 Bringing in your technical expertise, you will be providing world-class support to existing and prospective customers. You will diagnose, analyze problems and provide solutions to customers and refrigeration installers.
   

  

 Danfoss Cooling Segment develops the technologies of today and tomorrow in Food Retail, Air Conditioning, Industrial and Commercial Refrigeration.
   

  

**We are open for candidates from all locations and can offer remote work.**
****Job Responsibilities****
 Responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to the following.
   

  

* Providing technical support to cooling customers and prospects by phone and mail
* Maintaining customers, sales support and technical activities using salesforce CRM system
* Supporting internal commercial and sales staff in technical issues
* Working together in an international team
* Leading a customer on the phone in order to solve his technical issue or answer product related questions
* Provide internal and external trainings


****Background & Skills****
**The Ideal Candidate Possesses These Skills**
* Degree as Foreman in Refrigeration, Certified Refrigeration Technician or academic – related to refrigeration
* More than 5 years of technical experience within refrigeration applications desired
* Good technical knowledge in typical refrigeration applications
* Good technical understanding of Commercial Refrigeration
* Strong communication skills (mainly via phone)
* Business / technically fluent in English language is essential (speaking and writing)
* Strong personal resilience, highly motivated team player with a strong personal drive
* Good presentation and explaining skills, both verbal and written
* Strong team player with an analytical, proactive approach - mind-set on the customer and to support sales
* Managing difficult or emotional customer situations with fast response time; Solicit customer feedback to improve service, meet commitments


****Employee Benefits****
 We are excited to offer you the following benefits with your employment:
   

  

* Bonus system
* Paid vacation
* Flexible working hours
* Possibility to work remotely
* Pension plan
* Personal insurance
* Communication package
* Opportunity to join Employee Resource Groups
* State of the art virtual work environment
* Employee Referral Program


 This list does not promise or guarantee any particular benefit or specific action. They may depend on country or contract specifics and are subject to change at any time without prior notice.
   

  

****Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow****
 At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways - driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.
   

  

 Following our founder’s mindset “action speaks louder than words”, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.
   

  

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.

title: Sales Operations Coordinator / Deal Desk
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 








**At Yubico, we offer:**








**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role:
 









 Yubico is looking for a dynamic, experienced, highly driven Deal Desk Specialist that will be responsible for deal support to a regional sales team. 
 









 Our primary focus is increasing sales effectiveness; we are passionate about how Deal Desk can help the sales team be more strategic and efficient. This role will work with cross-functional teams such as Sales, Legal, Finance and Product. 
 









 You should be a detail-oriented self-starter who enjoys working in a fast-paced organization with users from all levels of the company. You should be able to provide sound business insight for building operational excellence as well as have a good understanding of sales cycles, complex hardware and software deal structures, and the complexities of global transactions and hardware fulfillment.  
 









 At Yubico, we work closely as a team, value respect and humility and are always willing to pitch in and help other members of the team. We are looking for someone who is passionate about Deal Desk, enjoys working closely with sales, embraces challenges, and possesses the emotional smarts to tackle them.
 









  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Drive data integrity in SFDC and manage account data
* Support sales with data (PO entry) entry in SFDC
* Assist in training and clarifying to sales what is needed (as well as helping out hands-on)
* Maintain backend communication between Yubico and our Partners
* Assist the sales team through the sales process in account management, quote creation/management, and opportunity management
* Understand the Sales Cycle (Lead-to-Cash) and secure the organizational requirements are met
* Ensure deals are well structured, aligned to company policy, and ready to be processed efficiently
* Work cross functionally to improve overall operational processes as well as document and communicate current policy and process
* Assist Sales Operations team with process improvements
* Work closely with Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, & Legal teams to align our processes to make the deal close in a frictionless, timely manner
* Process Purchase Orders and Review Deals via Yubico AB and GmbH
* Act as Order Support for Distributors in EMEA and APJ
* Pre- and Post-sale Support for our internal sales and channel reps
* for orders through Yubico AB and GmbH
* Assist in Account Approvals



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Prefer experience relating to Deal Desk activities
* Salesforce experience
* Good understanding of cross-system data integrity






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 







 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 







 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 







 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Data Engineer for cloud environment in Data team / Financing department | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB has started an exciting transformational journey to become the most data-driven bank in the world. Are you ambitious, driven, and curious, and want to continually develop your knowledge and skills? Then here you have an opportunity to take an important role as a Data Engineer in Data Team in Financing department where you can work in Google Cloud environment.
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a data engineer, you will be in a team where you will be helping the teams in the department on data transformation to GCP and for adding data driven functionality to their applications. You will work in an international environment with multiple agile teams located in Stockholm and Vilnius.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

 As a data engineer, we believe that you have a solid data engineer background and this you combine with knowledge in Google Cloud. You have experience within Python and are experienced in data engineering. We are looking for someone who has a great interest in learning new things and exploring new techniques.
   

  

 In order to thrive here, you should be interested in engineering problems and like finding creative solutions to complex problems. If you are analytical, curious and have a passion for discovering new ways of working, you will enjoy it here!
   

  

**Required Skills**
* Excellent programming skills in Python.
* Google Cloud Knowledge.
* Collaboration skills and high sense of responsibility. We are working team based, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
* Version control systems (Gitlab, Github).
* Cloud Sql, Postgres.
* Bigquery.
* Cloud Functions (GCP).
* Knowledge Terraform as IAC( infrastructure as code).
* Basic knowledge regarding ETL/ELT pipelines in GCP with some tools.(Eg Dataflow Dataform).
* CICD basic knowledge.


**Nice-to-have**
* Pyspark.
* Hive, Hql.
* Airflow.


 What we offer
   

  

* Agile and modern ways of working.
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas.
* Challenging, cutting-edge work.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to SEB Financing department. Since we select candidates on running bases, feel free to send in your application today! If you have questions about the position, please contact Yesim Tum (Team Manager), via email yesim.tum@seb.se. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Technical Process Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
**Role** 
 – Technical Process Specialist
   

  

**Technology** 
 – IT Support
   

  

**Location** 
 – Sweden
   

  

**Compensation** 
 – negotiable
   

  

**Job Description**
 Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic, and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.
   

  

 At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what’s next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.
   

  

**Your Role**
 You provide end user support on-site, maintain hardware and fixes technical problems, provide first-time resolution by troubleshooting and diagnosing or escalating faults (or both) to service desk managers, incident & problem managers and coordinates with remote teams for technical issues to investigate and resolve.
   

  

* Application and OS Maintenance: Provide maintenance and support services for applications and operating systems, either directly to users or through service delivery functions
* Diagnostic Troubleshooting: Gather extensive diagnostic information, analyze problems, and resolve issues related to end-user computing (EUC) devices
* Incident and Problem Management: Investigate and resolve incidents and problems affecting EUC devices, peripherals, and installed software
* Performance Monitoring: Monitor and address performance-related issues
* User Training and Advice: Provide advice, training, and corrections (permanent or temporary) to users
* Documentation and Enhancements: Update or create documentation, manipulate data, and define enhancements
* Collaboration: Collaborate closely with colleagues specializing in different areas (e.g., database administration, network support), vendors, and third-party support provider


**Required**
* Prior experience in a customer-focused end-user support role is valuable. This could include roles like Help Desk Technician, Desktop Support Specialist, or similar positions
* Swedish & English language proficiency
* Customer-Focused Support: Experience in a customer-focused end-user support function covering EUC and software/OS installations and support
* Incident Resolution: Proficiency in incident resolution, requests, changes, and problem-solving activities delivered within agreed service level agreements (SLAs)
* Microsoft Product Knowledge: Good knowledge of Microsoft’s product offerings, including high-level capabilities and competitor products.


**Overview**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation.
   

  

 With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

**All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.**

title: Data Engineer with interest in Financial Crime Prevention | SEB, Stockholm
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
**Join Our Mission Against Financial Crime**
 Would you like to work with a team of highly skilled Software Engineers to build solutions that empower complex investigations? We’re looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Financial Crime Prevention team—where data, technology, and purpose align to detect and prevent bad actors.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Engineer in the Financial Crime Prevention team, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining new technical capabilities in a smart way to allow us to detect bad actors. Here you will have a chance to make a difference and work with challenging tasks. You will have great opportunities to both develop and take further steps in your career working within a highly collaborative environment.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience in large scale Data Engineering projects
* Experience in Streaming technology such as Data Flow
* Experience of batch technology such as Data Proc
* Experience in Schema Registry
* Experience in Infrastructure as Code such as Terraform
* Knowledge in Graph DB is an advantage
* Analytical mindset and ability to solve complex technical problems
* Passion for challenges to drive your personal development and professional growth
* Being a team player open for growth and learning is crucially important for the role


**What We Offer**
* Innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Work-life balance
* Friendly and welcoming culture


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of April 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact rasmus.hallberg@seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here** 
 : www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: IT Security Specialist to Sweco IT
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Architecture and Planning, and Environmental Services
description:
*Do you want to be part of shaping a sustainable future through innovative technology? At Sweco IT, we’re looking for a driven and engaged IT security specialist to join our team. You’ll be contributing to digital capabilities to support Sweco’s mission of a sustainable transformation of society* 
*.*
 You will be part of a team that has a strong culture of helping each other, collaboration, and striving for improvements. The IT Security team is committed to ensuring that our IT systems are secure and that our employees have the necessary tools and knowledge to perform their work securely. We believe in sharing knowledge and supporting each other's growth and development. You will have the opportunity to work with experienced IT professionals who are dedicated to their work and committed to achieving the best results.
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 In this role you will work closely with other IT teams to conduct security assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and assess risk levels. You will also work with other IT colleagues to ensure that all software and hardware are up to date with the latest security patches and updates. You will perform security assessments of cloud applications to visualise potential risks during application reviews.
   

  

**Other Responsibilities In The Role Includes**
* Assist in planning, implementing, and management of security measures to protect our IT infrastructure, networks, and systems from cyber-attacks, fraud, and other security breaches.
* Assist in developing and implement security policies and procedures and ensure that they are followed by all employees.
* Monitor and analyse security events and incidents and respond to security alerts and notifications.
* Stay up to date with the latest IT security trends, threats, and best practices.
* Respond to discovered incidents and work with resolving requests.


**About You**
 To be successful in the role as IT security specialist, we believe you have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. You have the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. You communicate in an efficient way at different levels and can explain complex security issues to non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Proven experience with IT-Security, or equalling fields in IT, for a couple of years
* Good understanding of Microsoft Entra ID and Microsoft Azure IaaS
* Good knowledge about security software and tools, including firewalls, antivirus & EDR software, intrusion detection systems, and vulnerability scanners.
* Good knowledge in scripting e.g. PowerShell and Python


**Why join Sweco?**
* Professional development opportunities and various training opportunities.
* A pleasant and dynamic working atmosphere in a growing and leading company.
* An industry that is going through a major shift in way of working
* A culture that values inclusion, innovation, and continuous learning
* Flexible work with freedom and responsibility and a competitive compensation package.


**Can you see yourself as a part of Sweco?**
 Then don’t hesitate to send us your application and CV via the link below. We will review applications ongoing, so make sure you apply as soon as possible and no later than 20th of May.
   

  

 We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact us. We will get back to all applicants after the recruitment process has been completed.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of shaping the future? Then we look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Contact Us**
 If you want to know more about the position or Sweco as a workplace, please contact Patrik Cederlöf, IT-Security Team Manager, at patrik.cederlof@sweco.se.
   

  

 Background checks will be carried out on the final candidate as part of this recruitment process.
   

  

*Sweco plans and designs the sustainable communities and cities of the future. Together with our customers, our 22,000 architects, engineers and other experts develop solutions to manage urbanization, take advantage of the opportunities of digitalization and make the societies of the future more sustainable. Sweco is the leading consulting company in technology and architecture in Europe with a turnover of approximately SEK 29 billion. The company is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For further information,* 
*http //www.sweco.se*

title: Senior Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   





 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

**Required:**



* 5+ years of relevant experience
* Deep knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure
* Minimum 4 years experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers



**Nice to Have:**



* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**

 A chance to participate in the development of a leading global software firm. You have the opportunity to work within an organization, that gives you the freedom and autonomy to be successful. An attractive salary while working in a challenging international environment with enthusiastic colleagues who like to learn from each other.
   





 At Unit4 we invest in your personal and professional growth. We don't focus on how many days you work, we trust you on delivering results - thus, we have an unlimited vacation policy.
   





**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**
