title: Kommunikatör till Skånes Kommuner
description:
Om arbetsplatsen


Skånes Kommuner är en medlemsorganisation för de 33 skånska kommunerna. Vi är en politiskt styrd organisation och vår styrelse består av förtroendevalda från våra medlemskommuner.  

  

Skånes Kommuner söker nu en skicklig kommunikatör som brinner för att skapa engagerande och informativt innehåll. Arbetet är framför allt operativt och vi söker en mångsidig kommunikatör med bred erfarenhet.  

  

Vi erbjuder dig en unik möjlighet att vara med och utveckla vår verksamhet i en framåtblickande miljö. Här arbetar du i ett kreativt och dynamiskt arbetsklimat, där du ges stort ansvar och möjlighet att bidra till betydelsefulla projekt. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor arbetar vi för hållbara lösningar och en starkare framtid för Skånes kommuner.  

  

Du kommer att vara organiserad under avdelning utbildning och arbetsmarknad men har ett delat uppdrag i organisationen. Du kommer arbeta med uppgifter på övergripande operativ och strategisk nivå till 50% och 50% med uppdrag specifikt riktat till avdelning utbildning och arbetsmarknad med fokus på webbplatsen Skånevux.


Arbetsuppgifter


Som kommunikatör hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att skapa, stötta och driva arbetet operativt med vår interna och externa kommunikation. Du kommer att producera eget innehåll anpassat för olika plattformar och kanaler samt följa upp och utvärdera utfallet av kommunikativa insatser. Du kommer att ansvara för innehåll och att säkerställa följsamhet gällande lagar och riktlinjer på bland annat organisationens webbplatser, sociala kanaler och intranät samt utveckla dessa plattformar utifrån kommunikationsbehovet.  

  

I din roll som kommunikatör arbetar du självständigt för att föra arbetet framåt, du kommer att vara sammankallande för olika arbetsgrupper och driva processer inom kommunikationsområdet.  

  

Du kommer att ansvara för att utarbeta de strategiska dokument, mallar och grafiskt material som är ett stöd för kommunikation intern och externt.  

  

Vid behov hanterar du kontakter med media och stöttar våra chefer i internkommunikation. Andra arbetsuppgifter inom arbetsgivarens verksamhetsområde kan också förekomma.


Kvalifikationer


Relevant akademisk utbildning inom medie- och kommunikationsvetenskap eller annan utbildning med arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren anser relevant för uppdraget.  

  

Aktuell erfarenhet av att planera och genomföra kommunikationsinsatser som är anpassade för olika målgrupper och kanaler samt erfarenhet av att analysera, mäta och utvärdera dessa.  

  

God förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska, kunna formulera tydliga budskap, skriva i klarspråk och anpassa texter för olika målgrupper och kanaler.  

  

God kunskap om digital kommunikation och trender för sociala medier och van att jobba med webbpublicering (exempelvis Wordpress och nyhetsbrev) samt kunskap och förståelse för tillgänglighetsdirektivet.  

  

Erfarenhet av bild- och layoutarbete samt kunskaper i programvaror inom Adobe Creative Cloud.  

  

Erfarenhet av att ansvara för utveckling och förvaltning av webb  

  

Det är meriterande om du också har:  

  

Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en komplex organisation, gärna offentlig verksamhet.  

  

Erfarenhet från ett liknande uppdrag inom gymnasie- och vuxenutbildning.  

  

Vi värdesätter att du har lätt för att samarbeta, är flexibel och lyhörd både i arbetsgruppen och med resten av verksamheten. Du är en självgående, drivande och lösningsorienterad person med en utvecklad känsla för service. Du uppskattar en lärande organisation och delar gärna med dig av dina kunskaper. Stor vikt läggs vid dina personliga egenskaper.


Ansökan


Referensnummer: C246380

title: Fundraising manager (parental cover), Kvinna till Kvinna,...
description:
**Are you ready to take on a key role in driving successful fundraising initiatives? Do you have expertise in donor engagement and digital marketing? Join us as our Fundraising Manager (parental cover) and play a crucial role in strengthening women's rights.**

**About the Role**


As a Fundraising Manager, you will have overall responsibility for raising funds from new and existing individual donors, with a specific focus on small donations (including all monthly donors and all donations under 10,000 SEK). You will lead donor acquisition via digital channels and together with the team cultivate relationships with existing donors through email and SMS communication.


You will be part of a dynamic team working with fundraising, marketing, and communications on the Swedish market. The role is based at our headquarters in Hammarby Sjöstad in Stockholm and reports to the Communication and Policy Director. The position is a parental leave replacement for 10 months, starting 6 August 2025 and ends 31 May 2026.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead the acquisition of new monthly donors and one-time donors.
* Plan and run Kvinna till Kvinna’s advertising in social media.
* Develop and produce content for social media ads, email, and SMS, including imagery, and copywriting.
* Develop fundraising activities via email and SMS for existing donors in collaboration with the person in charge of CRM-loyalty.
* Develop and manage fundraising activities for the emergency fund.
* Track and analyse revenue and expenses to ensure alignment with budget goals.

**Qualifications & Experience**

**Required:**

* Relevant higher education in marketing, communications, digital media, or a related field.
* Experience in fundraising, with a focus on digital channels and small donors, preferably in a non-profit setting.
* Expertise in digital marketing, including paid social.
* Hands on experience with platforms such as Meta ads manager, Adoveo, Marketing Cloud, and Salesforce/AXSP or similar CRM-system.
* Experience in budgeting, planning, and financial accountability.
* Proficiency in analytics tools to measure and report results (e.g., Google Analytics, CRM tools).
* Strong writing and communication skills in Swedish for creating compelling donor content across email, SMS, and advertising in social media.
* Proven ability to develop and execute donor acquisition and retention strategies.
* Track record in monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs), such as new monthly donor acquisitions and fundraising results via SMS and email.

**Personal Attributes:**

* Proactive, independent, and result-oriented.
* Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a team environment.
* Detail-oriented and organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.

**What We Offer**


Working at Kvinna till Kvinna means being part of an inspiring workplace where your skills will directly contribute to driving positive change.


We have a hybrid work arrangement with the option to work remotely up to 50% of the time. Average weekly work hours are 37,5 hours. We offer wellness time during working hours and wellness allowance.

**Type of Employment:** this is a full-time position, substitute employment, lasting until 31 May 2026.

**Start Date:** 6 August 2025, according to agreement

**Deadline for applying**: 20 April


Application: include a CV and personal letter, apply via the button below.


We look forward to your application.

title: Risk Manager
description:
Our Credit & Analytics department is known for being one of the most forward-thinking in the Nordics, made up of talents from across the globe. Within this department, the Credit Underwriting & Decision Analytics unit focuses on continuously improving our automated underwriting processes and monitoring risk performance. As our unsecured portfolios across the Nordics grow in both size and complexity, we’re now looking for a **Risk Manager** to join us on this exciting journey and help influence our future solutions.


Whether you're located in **Oslo** (Fornebu) or **Stockholm** (Gävlegatan 22), this is an opportunity to join a bank that is growing fast and shaping the future of consumer finance in Europe.


At **Bank Norwegian and Nordax Bank**, we believe in simplicity, transparency, and technology-driven innovation. As part of NOBA Bank Group, we offer consumer loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance – all made available through cutting-edge technology, automation, and seamless self-service platforms.  

  

**About the role:**

  

Credit underwriting is within the absolute core for a bank operating within unsecured credits. Working and coordinating with stakeholders from multiple departments is essential, and internally we simply refer to this role as having the day-to-day responsibility for “running the bank”.

**Main tasks:**

* Significant responsibility as being risk manager for a portfolio.
* Continuously analyze your portfolio to identify underwriting opportunities that drive smarter decisions.
* Lead and coordinate cross-functional initiatives to improve underwriting strategies in cooperation with key stakeholders.
* Develop and enhance risk reporting using analytical tools.
* Support strategic growth initiatives by conducting deep-dive analyses across products and markets.
* Contribute to model validation processes and ensure compliance with internal standards.
* Identify untapped data opportunities and turn them into actionable insights.
* Collaborate on other tasks within Credit Underwriting & Decision Analytics to support our continuous improvement journey.

**We are looking for you who:**

* Minimum 3 – 5 years’ experience working within credit risk (preferably within the Nordic countries or Germany)
* Minimum 2 years’ experience with SQL programming
* Fluency in English (Scandinavian language skills is a plus)
* Proficiency in a modeling language such as Python or R
* A degree in a quantitative field (Economics, Statistics, Data Science or similar)
* Have the right to work in either Sweden or Norway (citizenship or valid work permit)

Its positive if you:* Experience with **IFRS9 modelling** (PD, LGD, EAD)
* Familiarity with **reporting tools** such as Power BI or Tableau
* Exposure to **cloud platforms** (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP)
* 

**Who you are?**

  

Knowing it’s a lot to ask for, but if you are creative, curious and have strong communication and analytical skills at the same time, we think you could make a huge impact on our business. You are eager to use data and willing to challenge and improve existing methods. You enjoy both working independently and collaborating closely with others.

**What we offer?**

* Collaboration cross the brands
* A dynamic, international and tech-driven workplace
* Significant responsibility as being risk manager for a portfolio
* Great collaboration with experienced and supportive colleagues
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Flexible working hours and hybrid setup
* A flat and informal organization with a startup mentality — but with the stability of an established bank

**Why join us?**


We put **professional development** at the core of our success. We believe in simplicity, transparency, and technology-driven innovation. At NOBA Bank you’ll find an international and friendly workplace with a flat structure, informal culture and high level of trust and autonomy. We’re currently around **200 employees** at Bank Norwegian, and over **600 across the Nordax Bank**.


Our culture is built on collaboration, curiosity, and shared success — and we’re proud to live by our values:  

*We are wholehearted*  

*We collaborate*  

*We take the lead*

  

Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?  

In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra *bubbly*!
  

Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.

  

We strive for diversity of knowledge and experiences among our employees and welcome all applicants who are qualified for the position. We are committed to a recruitment process free from discrimination that provides equal opportunities for all.

 **What happens when you have submitted your application?**  

The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.



If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Rebecca Khan at rebecca.khan@nordax.se


We look forward to receiving your application!
  

  

NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave. If you have protected personal information, please inform the responsible recruiter so that we can handle your personal data correctly.

title: Head of Operations
description:
**Introducing evroc**


At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European-owned hyperscale cloud.

**Location:** London or Stockholm

**Job type:** Permanent position

**Join the Pioneers**


At the outset of our journey, we're not just building software; we're laying the groundwork for our technology solutions and how we’ll operate as an engineering team. As we expand, the organisation of our teams and the specialisation into product areas hinge on these formative decisions. Coming on board now means you're not just coding - you're contributing directly to how we set ourselves up for success, how we tackle challenges, and how we define our engineering culture. This isn’t just a job; it's a chance to leave an indelible mark on our technology, teams, culture, and ethos.

 **What You'll Tackle**

* Direct global operations teams across multiple data centres and regions.
* Establish and optimize support infrastructure, SLAs, and escalation protocols.
* Develop metrics and KPIs to measure operational performance and customer satisfaction.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service reliability and efficiency.
* Manage large-scale incident response and problem resolution processes.
* Build and lead technical support teams across multiple tiers.
* Collaborate with engineering on product improvements based on operational insights.
* Establish standardized operating procedures and playbooks.
* Lead crisis management during major service disruptions.

**Skills We Value**

* 10+ years of experience in technical operations management, preferably in cloud services.
* Proven leadership experience managing large, distributed technical teams.
* Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure, virtualization, and networking.
* Track record implementing automation and operational efficiency improvements.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with incident management and problem resolution at scale.
* Knowledge of compliance requirements for cloud services.
* MBA or technical degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Experience with data analytics and performance measurement systems.


We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!


At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.


Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Senior Integration Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**About us:**


Our team is the heartbeat of Continuous Integration (CI) and build automation for the EACS agile release train, driving the development of Android-based automotive infotainment systems. We are a Kanban-driven team of four developers and a PO, dedicated to creating fast, stable, and scalable CI/CD solutions that empower our developers to build high-quality software with confidence.


Our mission? To streamline and optimize the development process by maintaining robust CI pipelines, automating builds and testing, and improving infrastructure performance. We work with cutting-edge Android build systems, automation tools, and cloud-based CI/CD technologies, ensuring that software integration is smooth, efficient, and reliable.


As a part of this team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of CI, collaborate with skilled engineers, and tackle exciting challenges in automation, scalability, and performance optimization. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and love building tools that make developers’ lives easier, we’d love to have you on board

**About the role:**


As a Senior Integration Engineer, you will:

* Design and improve CI/CD pipelines to power next-generation vehicle software.
* Automate workflows to ensure smooth and reliable deliveries.
* Collaborate with supportive, skilled teammates who respect and value different perspectives.
* Solve real-world challenges in a role where your voice drives innovation.
* Learn, experiment, and contribute to shaping the future of sustainable transport.
**Requirements and qualifications:**

* Experience with CI/CD, automation, and software integration.
* Proficiency in Jenkins, Git/Gerrit, Docker, scripting
* A problem-solving mindset and a drive for quality.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative approach.

  

Nice-to-haves:

* Experience with Android Automotive OS, Embedded Systems, or Linux.
* Interest in mentoring, leadership, or knowledge-sharing.
* A desire to learn and grow in a supportive team environment.
**Ready for the next move?**


Join us You belong here. If you want to lead, innovate, and grow, apply today!


Want to learn more? Contact our Talent Acquisition Partner, Batool Malik at: batool.malik@volvo.com

 **Last application date: 16th April 2025**

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Senior QA Automation Engineer
description:
### **Position**


Magine Pro is looking for a Senior QA Automation Engineer with a background in test automation, Agile testing, and high-quality releases.


This role is crucial in scaling automation, optimizing quality processes, and enabling efficient, high-confidence releases through advanced test automation, CI/CD integration, and proactive test strategy leadership.

**Your role:**

* Lead implementation of scalable test automation solutions for mobile, TV, and backend services.
* Work alongside engineering teams to embed testing earlier in development (Shift Left) and improve testability.
* Automate end-to-end testing for our subscription and billing platform, ensuring robust payment processing and entitlement validation.
* Reduce manual testing efforts through cloud-based device farms (AWS Device Farm, Firebase Test Lab, BrowserStack) to efficiently scale across multiple configurations.
* Integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, CircleCI) to support fast and confident releases.
* Promote agile testing principles, ensuring unit, integration, UI, and exploratory testing are effectively utilized across teams.
* Ensure automation frameworks are accessible and easy to extend, allowing team members to troubleshoot tests and contribute to automation.
* Contribute to automated/synthetic monitoring, particularly using Datadog to track system health, performance, and alerting.

**Who you are:**


We’re looking for someone who is:

* Curious and always looking to test new tools, approaches, and ideas
* **Open-minded**, collaborative, and eager to understand both code and context
* **Pragmatic**, with a sense for what should be automated and why
* Passionate about building automation that’s not only smart—but **usable, shared, and understood**
* Motivated by reducing pain points for users and improving release confidence
* Not afraid to refactor, simplify, and challenge your own assumptions

**Where:**

* Stockholm, Sweden - Hybrid

**Experience:**

* Proven expertise in automated testing for web & mobile applications, using Appium, Espresso, XCTest, Detox or similar.
* Strong API test automation skills (e.g. Postman/Insomnia, Charles-proxy)
* Experience with subscription-based platforms and payment processing testing.
* Proficiency in CI/CD test integration (GitHub Actions, CircleCI).
* Familiarity with device farms (AWS Device Farm, Firebase Test Lab, Sauce Labs, BrowserStack) for scaling mobile testing.
* Understanding of backend testing (microservices, billing, authentication, entitlements).
* Experience with Datadog for synthetic/automated monitoring.

Experience working in a B2B SaaS or streaming environment.  
* 

**The following knowledge will be seen as a bonus (if not, don't worry, if you're a fast learner, you'll be fine):**

* Experience with Bash/Zsh/Fish/Nushell shell scripting.
* Experience with version control systems, particularly Git.
* Experience working with Docker and containerization.
* Experience reading and writing functional programming code (we use Scala).
* AI-powered testing tools like Testim, Mabl, Applitools, Katalon.
* Performance testing experience with k6, Gatling, Artillery.
* Video delivery technology (Encode, Transcode, Storage, DRM, Player Tech).
* Experience with contract testing (e.g Pact, Spring Cloud Contract).
* Knowledge of AWS, Kubernetes, cloud-native testing strategies.

**What we offer**

  

* 6 weeks paid vacation
* 2,500 SEK health & wellness contribution
* Occupational pension contribution
* Computer/terminal glasses
* Remote work-friendly setup (with insurance coverage)
* Bonus days off, breakfasts, fika, afterworks, and team events
* Hack Days and learning-friendly culture

  

At Magine, we’re dedicated to connecting fantastic video to audiences in any corner of the globe. We partner with creators and distributors to enable them through every aspect of setting up their own OTT / video streaming service. We’re passionate about great content and our mission is to protect generations of creativity to come through high quality, safe and legal distribution.


We are a diverse group where everyone is equal and all ideas and opinions count. Flexibility in working and mind are important to be a part of a team in which change is, and will, happen constantly. Sounds exciting? We think so and we are looking for more talented people to join our team.


We offer an attractive salary, occupational pension and insurance plan, health care benefits, flexible work hours, a vibrant office setting in central Stockholm - plus 30 days of paid vacation. We offer the possibility to work remote, but we also appreciate to hang out with our colleagues, so every now and then we expect all team members to meet up at the office.


**Interested in joining Magine Pro?**  

Do not wait - do not hesitate - apply below now!

 *You must have a Swedish Visa / European working permit. No relocation package is offered.*

title: Researcher Standardization
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


As the pioneering tech firm that revolutionized the mobile world, with over 60,000 patents to our name, Ericsson is committed to shaping the future of technology. By joining our team, you’ll be empowered to learn, lead, and excel, contributing to groundbreaking advancements in mobile communications.

 **The Standards & Technology (S&T)** unit, part of Technology & Strategy within Business Area Networks, is dedicated to driving technology foresight from antennas to cloud. With nearly 300 highly skilled researchers and leaders across Stockholm, Lund, and Paris, S&T is responsible for Ericsson’s hardware and software research strategies, standardization efforts, target architecture, and the analysis of new Radio Access Network (RAN) concepts. We conduct technology proof-of-concepts and build testbed systems for future RAN generations.

  

Technology leadership is crucial to Ericsson's success. Our active involvement in standardization organizations ensures that our network products are supported by relevant standards, including Intellectual Property Rights (IPRs), thereby maximizing their competitive advantage and solidifying our position as having the thought leadership in the industry. Standardization also provides business intelligence and insights from the industry landscape, that in turn, influences Ericsson’s products and technology plans.


The Standardization unit within Standards and Technology is responsible for BNEW standardization strategies and execution to make sure Ericsson is the continued leader in all standardization related to radio access networks.

  

The telecommunications industry is experiencing a transformative shift towards open and disaggregated network architectures, with Open RAN at the forefront of this evolution. At Ericsson, we are dedicated to defining and advancing Open RAN architecture as we move toward 6G, focusing on multivendor collaboration and standardization aspects. Open RAN leverages open, standardized interfaces, such as those from the O-RAN Alliance and 3GPP, to enable interoperability among disaggregated RAN components.

  

We are now looking for two persons to strengthen our team, **one in Stockholm and one in Lund.** You will contribute to fostering a healthy standardization ecosystem, balancing innovation freedom with timely market delivery and global standardization outreach.

 **What you will do:**

* Represent Ericsson as a standardization delegate or serve as a back-office researcher in key Open RAN standardization bodies and alliances, including the O-RAN Alliance.
* Actively participate in defining and executing standardization strategies relevant to Open RAN.
* Maintain a comprehensive Ericsson perspective on Open RAN standardization, driving internal alignment through dialogue, participation in relevant forums, and strategic influence.
* Engage in product-driven standardization, ensuring connectivity with product development units to align standards with product needs.
* Facilitate coordination between Product Development Units and relevant research work to support standardization efforts.
* Lead studies as a driver or reference person, promoting proactive engagement.
* Contribute to build the Open RAN architecture expertise within Ericsson, including sharing and information spreading.
* Support the generation of new IPR within the domain.
* Maintain and develop internal and external networks of experts in the domain.
**The skills you bring:**
-------------------------


* In-depth understanding of RAN architectures and technologies.
* Expertise in Open RAN and disaggregated architectures.
* Proven experience in RAN-related standardization, with prior delegation work as a plus.
* Exceptional communication and negotiation skills, characterized by transparency, active listening, and the ability to empower and motivate with empathy.
* Ability to simplify complex topics for diverse audiences with varying levels of expertise.
* Capacity to teach, mentor, challenge, and develop both individuals and teams.
* Serve as a role model for achieving excellent work-life balance.
* Ph.D., M.Sc., or equivalent qualifications.
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Req ID:** 764180
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Guidewire Project Manager (27215)
description:
Are you our new ambitious project manager, who has a great drive and desire to make your mark on the future daily operations in the claims department at the Nordic region's largest non-life insurance company? If so, you currently have a fantastic opportunity to become part of one of our most prioritized development areas within Trygg Hansa in Sweden, which is part of Danish Tryg Forsikring.  


We are looking for an engaged Project Manager for our Guidewire team at Trygg-Hansa. In this role, you will be part of the Program team that aims to create the best conditions for the organization to be part of the transformation. Here you have the opportunity to be at the forefront of our exciting journey as Trygg-Hansa embarks on its largest business transformation by implementing the Cloud-based core system, Guidewire. The Guidewire implementation is the largest investment in the Tryg group and the most important strategic initiative during this strategic period.  


**About the job | Dedicated project manager for the implementation of Guidewire**  

As a Project Manager within the Guidewire program's Inception phase, you are responsible for driving the process to prepare the insurance products for implementation in the new Claims core system, Guidewire. The preparation includes responsibility for the overall project plan and driving it to completion, including facilitating analyses of claim types, analytics, the customer journey for the product, gathering business requirements, understanding complexity, and involving stakeholders at all levels.  


The role requires your ability to understand the organization's change needs and to drive an aggressive project plan forward.  


Your main responsibilities will include the following:
* Be responsible for driving the pre-inception and inception phases in the Guidewire program, which involves all preparatory work for all insurance products in Trygg-Hansa before implementation in Guidewire.
* Lead a team with various competencies (business analysts, process developers, claims handlers, etc.)
* Act as a link between different stakeholders, including team members, management, and external parties.
* Identify potential risks and develop strategies to minimize or eliminate them.


The role is a full-time position, located in Malmö or Stockholm, and reports to Frida Arvidsson, Head of Business Development & Transformation Claims SE. Your daily sparring will be with the Director & Business Owner of Guidewire in Claims SE, Caroline Bødker.  


**About you | Committed and goal-oriented with an administrative flair**  

We are looking for a down-to-earth person with great commitment, drive, and perseverance with a structuring and administrative vein. It is important that you are trustworthy as a person, have the ability to navigate a complex stakeholder landscape, take responsibility for the results you deliver, and are skilled at communicating and engaging stakeholders.
We believe that you who apply have:
* Experience in supporting or leading parts of core system exchanges in the insurance industry
* Plan and structure projects to ensure effective implementation.
* Communicate clearly and concisely with team members and stakeholders.
* Inspire and motivate the team and resolve conflicts when they arise.
* Identify problems quickly and find creative solutions.
* Manage time and deadlines effectively to keep the project on track.
* Adapt to changes and unexpected challenges.
* Good skills in PowerPoint.


**About us | We take responsibility, show trust, and foster developmen**  

With us, you become part of a team with knowledgeable and curious colleagues in a company that lives by the following characteristics – we create development, we show trust, and we take responsibility. We believe that personal commitment is good for both you and the company, and you therefore have the opportunity to use a few working days per year for voluntary work. We recognize the importance of and actively work to be an inclusive workplace, where you should feel safe being yourself.  


We offer great flexibility in how you carry out your work and very good opportunities to grow in your role. Here you have the opportunity to work both from home and in a modern and easily accessible office to meet colleagues, collaborate, and network.  


**Application | We look forward to hearing from you**  

Welcome to submit your application via the link below. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, but no later than 2025-04-15.  


If you have any questions about the position, please contact Caroline Bødker, Director & Business Owner of the Guidewire program, Claims SE via email at caroline.b@trygghansa.se.
Please note that we do not accept applications via email.  


Final candidates will undergo a background check.  


Welcome to submit your application!  


**Union representatives**  

Akademikerföreningen: Lena Darin, lena.darin@trygghansa.se  

Forena: Elias Bakk, elias.bakk@trygghansa.se

title: VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator
description:
* Deploy and configure VMware Cloud Director components.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with vCenter Server and NSX for networking.
* Configure resource pools, storage policies, and other infrastructure elements.
* Create and manage organizations (tenants) and assign roles and permissions to users and groups.
* Enforce security policies and manage access controls.
* Allocate and manage compute, storage, and network resources for tenants.
* Monitor resource utilization and ensure optimal performance.
* Handle resource scaling for dynamic workloads.
* Onboard new tenants and set up their virtual datacenters (vDCs).
* Provide tenants with self-service portals and catalog access.
* Handle tenant-specific configurations, such as virtual networking and VM templates.
* Apply updates and patches to VMware Cloud Director and underlying infrastructure.
* Conduct backup and disaster recovery testing.
* Leverage APIs to automate provisioning and management tasks.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with third-party tools or custom scripts for automation.
* Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory standards.



 Key Skills and Knowledge Areas
 


* Virtualization: Deep understanding of VMware vSphere, including ESXi hosts and vCenter Server.
* Networking: Knowledge of VMware NSX (V or T), VLANs, VPNs, and software-defined networking (SDN).
* Storage: Experience with storage systems and VMware storage technologies like vSAN.
* Cloud Management: Familiarity with multi-tenancy and self-service concepts.
* Scripting: Skills in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or RESTful API usage.
* Security: Understanding of security principles, firewalls, and access control.



 Tools and Technologies
 


* VMware Cloud Director: Primary platform for administration.
* vSphere/vCenter: Managing the underlying infrastructure.
* NSX: For networking and security.
* vRealize Suite: Includes tools like vRealize Operations and vRealize Orchestrator.
* Third-party integrations: Tools like Terraform or Ansible for infrastructure as code

title: Senior Cloud Security Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Senior Cloud Security Engineer to join our growing security team. You will be part of our cybersecurity group which is committed to building a strong security foundation across Vizrt. In your role as the senior cloud security engineer, you will have the opportunity and responsibility to shape Vizrt's cloud journey while making sure we are following the highest security standards in this area.
   





 What You'll Do{​{:}}
 


* Design, implement, and enhance cloud security controls across AWS and Azure.
* Identify and mitigate cloud security risks, ensuring compliance with industry standards.
* Integrate current security tooling and identify potential gaps in our cloud security controls.
* Collaborate with RnD teams to embed security best practices into cloud infrastructure.
* Lead incident response efforts related to cloud security threats and misconfigurations.
* Work with internal stakeholders to define and enforce security policies.
* Own and drive cloud security initiatives across AWS and Azure.
* Develop automation and security tooling to reduce manual effort to strengthen cloud security.
* Stay ahead of emerging cloud security threats and drive proactive risk mitigation strategie

 s
   

  


**Requirement**

 s
 * 5+ years of experience in cloud security, with hands-on expertise in mainly AWS plus Azure.
* Strong understanding of identity & access management, network security, and cloud-native security tools.
* Cloud security certifications are appreciated, but are not mandatory. It is an extra bonus if you have experience with hands-on penetration testing of cloud environments.
* Experience with security automation, SIEM, and threat detection in cloud environments.
* Familiarity with IaC (Terraform, CloudFormation) and CI/CD security practices.
* Ability to work independently in a remote environment and drive security initiatives.
* Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive security mindse

**Benefit**

 sWe offer an exciting position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact on Vizrt;'s
 



 .
